job_title: Mental Health Worker in Pasadena, CA
pros: My coworkers were a great, hard-working team. The staffing are communicative and often text back within an hour while they are working. The job offers excellent experience.
cons: The hospital is old and therefore the buildings have a decent amount of issues. When patients complain about the water taking a long time to get hot or the toilet getting clogged easily, there's not much I can say or do. The staffing can also be inflexible and harsh when it comes to important issues such as bereavement or sick days.

review_title: Not a bad place to start
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pasadena, CA
pros:
CNO is amazing
Will hire anyone
cons: Low pay, not very flexible

pros: Las Encinas has a beautiful campus, and the grounds and layout lend to a serene and peaceful work environment that does not feel like a traditional hospital.  Over the past year and a half the CEO has helped to foster a greater sense of professionalism and accountability, has endorsed staff education/training, and has helped us to develop academic affiliations and partnerships with universities in pursuit of becoming a center of excellence.  Although the team is not perfect, I get a sense that leadership and management really care about the hospital and the staff.  The patients are amazing and probably the biggest reason I come to work every day, and many of my co-workers are also highly skilled and dedicated, and they feel like family.  People tend to stick around for a long time, and many staff have been here for over a decade.
cons: Sometimes low staffing can be an issue, and the job is incredibly fast paced and tiring on some days.  The patients we work with are very acute, so it can be challenging and takes a special skill set and personality to do this type of work.  Salary and benefits are decent but could be better.  The facility still uses paper charts, which can make charting difficult; however, there is a plan to go to an electronic record after the new building is completed early next year (2019).

pros: Good coworkers, lunch provided, parking
cons: Short hours, manager was more of a tyrant

pros: Great -workers, ability to care for patients, teamwork, and a learning environment.   Ice cream with amazing toppings once a month, fun treats are appreciated!   Being able to provide show care for patients and families who do not often understand the illnesses and often do not want to be there is at the heart of most  staff and that is the best Pro.
cons: Management says one thing and visibly does another. Expectations are great but the negativity will not get us there.  Great acting by CEO and his selected few.  So many changes and no direction.  A lot of work for the amount time given to complete.  Benefits are decent.  More staff allocated to units, there is not enough time to complete all tasks efficiently

review_title: Get your hours for your license and then get out!
job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Pasadena, CA
pros:
There are some great staff members who give great patient care, but very few.
Sometimes there's an ice cream social.
Opportunity to learn to work with high acuity patients.
cons:
Extremely dangerous. They are always understaffed and there are many violent and severe injuries to patients and staff.
HR is useless, vindictive, and retaliatory.
Hard workers get more work and less pay. 
Nepotism is prevalent.
Admin is never available.
They are always in danger of being shut down by county, state, and fed. We were told not to directly answer surveyors, but to refer to a binder with approved responses.
They promote people to admin without the qualifications or experience.
Some doctors refuse to help those who cannot pay.
New hires with little to no experience get paid much more than employees of the same title that have been there for years.

review_title: Employees are awesome but management are bullies.
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Pasadena, CA
pros: Great people to work with among nurses, some doctors, and some therapists. Patients can very funny as some are professional the entertainment industry. But for the most part patients are cool people to hang with.
cons: The management of the Hospital campus have installed cameras  with in nurses station monitoring employees 24/7. You feel like someone is always watching over your back. The management couldn't care less about their employees. Pay structure is lower than the industry average and if you ask for an increase in payment. then they (management) will give every excuse in the book(the economy) to not give you a pay raise. Newer employees will have a higher pay then the veterans.

pros:
I was able to get a pretty flexible schedule which helped me pursue my education while working
There is a lot of opportunity to work closely with patients 
The staff is pretty tight so it can be a lot of fun if you get to know everybody
The building itself is over a 100yrs old and does not look or feel like a psych hospital
cons:
The hospital is over a 100 yrs old lol!
There's a lot of ground to cover between units so it takes time to get around

pros: The pros are all gone.  No more free lunch. No flexibility. No grace.
cons: The staff is miserable. They are vastly underpaid compared to other hospitals. They are micromanaged by an administration who only cares about money. The environment is often dangerous because not enough staff are employed.  If a surprise audit were to happen tomorrow, the place would most likely be shut down.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Pasadena, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, Work with you on your schedule. Great place to work if your going to school
cons: Supervisor not strict enough and everyone does what they want in my department. Benefits are not that great. Other than that I love working here

review_title: Work hard and you WONT move up or be able to transfer.
pros: Co-workers, Double Shifts, meeting patients from all walks of life. Assistant DON is the BEST! Love her!
cons: CEO and DON the WORST! Place is all about money and no care or compassion for patients! CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP! Run down facility, can’t move up if you work hard! Short staffed every day and shift! Harassed to work doubles every day! Low low wages.

review_title: Ceo not fit for the needs of the hospital
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good team work from those who are really trying to make changes
cons: Ceo is destroying that place. He is a two face, He is not loyal to anyone. He gives his staff tons of work and then breaks them down. He is spending money by paying useless people while the ones that work hard are disregarded and under paid. He does not care about his employees Many people dislike him and walk around lost and frustrated . He is wasting the companies money. No one can trust him. He is really insensitive to the needs of the people, including patients. He spends more time trying to save a penny rather than making sure he builds a good foundation. He has registry working there, they are useless and they make more money than his loyal employees. His mind is set on getting rid of people. These people have been there for years , he is destroying everyone's hope. He smiles in your face and talks about you . This place will not get better until someone gets him out.  He needs to walk around the units and see the hard work and  the need for more safety. Staff are working for 3. He sits in his nice office and judges everyone from a window view, he has no idea how unsafe the units are and how unhappy the staff is. Everyone's leaving!  The best you get is icecream social,  nothing social about it. Everyone eats the icecream plays the part and back to hell. There are no incentives unless you work on your day off or a double then you might get a movie ticket or a small bonus. Its just so sad and unreal.

pros:
